item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Paul Claudel
item.description: "L'ordre est le plaisir de la raison; mais le désordre est le délice de l'imagination" -- Paul Claudel

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Michael Marshall Smith
item.description: "Making something secret makes it too important, elevates it to the point where it runs your life from the shadows. If you hide what's at your core from other people for too long, sooner or later you end up hiding it from yourself and waking up with no idea of who you are." -- Michael Marshall Smith

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "Life is trouble. Only death is not. To be alive is to undo your belt and *look* for trouble." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Eileen Gunn
item.description: "Books are memory. They remember their contents and pass them on. They keep track of who claims ownership, who they were given by and for what occasion. They mediate, in their margins, disagreements between reader and author." -- Eileen Gunn

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "So the unwanting soul sees what's hidden, and the ever-wanting soul sees only what it wants." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Yevgeny Yevtushenko
item.description: "When truth is replaced by silence,the silence is a lie." -- Yevgeny Yevtushenko

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by John Dryden
item.description: "Beware the fury of a patient man." -- John Dryden

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "To forget the dead would be akin to killing them a second time." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Goethe/J.W.
item.description: "And I have again observed, my dear friend, in this trifling affair, that misunderstandings and neglect occasion more mischief in the world than even malice and wickedness. At all events, the two latter are of less frequent occurrence." -- Goethe/J.W.

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Primo Levi
item.description: "A country is considered the more civilised the more the wisdom and efficiency of its laws hinder a weak man from becoming too weak and a powerful one too powerful." -- Primo Levi

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Tim Kreider
item.description: "Most of my married friends now have children, the rewards of which appear to be exclusively intangible and, like the mysteries of some gnostic sect, incommunicable to outsiders. In fact it seems from the outside as if these people have joined a dubious cult: they claim to be much happier and more fulfilled than ever before, even though they live in conditions of appalling filth and degradation, deprived of the most basic freedoms and dignity, and owe unquestioning obedience to a capricious and demented master." -- Tim Kreider

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Robert Byron
item.description: "Somebody must trespass on the taboos of modern nationalism, in the interests of human reason. Business can't. Diplomacy won't. It has to be people like us." -- Robert Byron

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "The difference between stupid and intelligent people – and this is true whether or not they are well-educated – is that intelligent people can handle subtlety. " -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Harry Callahan (The Dead Pool)
item.description: "Well, opinions are like assholes. Everybody has one." -- Harry Callahan (The Dead Pool)

item.title: Psychophant add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa
